Package BobcatLib.Subsystems.Climbers.Modules

Class ClimberSim

java.lang.Object
BobcatLib.Subsystems.Climbers.Modules.ClimberSim
All Implemented Interfaces:
ClimberIO
public class ClimberSim extends Object implements ClimberIO
Real implementation of the ClimberIO interface for controlling a physical climber mechanism using motor control.

  • Nested Class Summary

  • Method Details

    • configClimber

      public void configClimber()
      Configures the climber motor and sets up limits and control parameters.

      This method should override the motor configuration in the BaseMotor class. Tasks include setting reverse and forward soft limits for upper and lower bounds, enabling proportional gain (kP), and applying current limits.

      Specified by:
      configClimber in interface ClimberIO

    • updateInputs

      public void updateInputs(ClimberIO.ClimberIOInputs inputs)
      Updates the input values of the climber, such as the current motor position.
      Specified by:
      updateInputs in interface ClimberIO
      Parameters:
      inputs - The ClimberIO.ClimberIOInputs object containing updated input data.

    • setPercentOut

      public void setPercentOut(double percent)
      Sets the motor output as a percentage of its maximum power.

      This value must be between -1.0 (full reverse) and 1.0 (full forward). No validation is performed on the input, so users must ensure the value is within the valid range.

      Specified by:
      setPercentOut in interface ClimberIO
      Parameters:
      percent - The desired motor output percentage (-1.0 to 1.0).

    • holdPos

      public void holdPos(double rot)
      Commands the climber motor to hold a specific position.
      Specified by:
      holdPos in interface ClimberIO
      Parameters:
      rot - The target position in rotations.
